main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties

Class ConfigGroupAsMMProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties.MMProperty<java.lang.String>
      • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties.ConfigGroupAsMMProperty

  • public class ConfigGroupAsMMProperty
extends MMProperty<java.lang.String>
    Instantiates a MMProperty that wraps a configuration group from Mico-manager. This is useful to map a UIProperty to multiple MMProperties as defined in Micro-Manager by the user (e.g. channels). All configuration groups are assigned to the same fictitious device. The groups are then considered as a property with allowed values being the channels.
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigGroupAsMMProperty

        public ConfigGroupAsMMProperty(org.micromanager.Application app,
                       mmcorej.CMMCore core,
                       java.lang.String groupName,
                       java.lang.String[] groupChannelNames,
                       java.util.ArrayList<MMProperty> affectedMMProps)
        Constructor. Instantiate the MMProperty has a property belonging to the device KEY_MMCONFDEVICE, with allowed values being the different channel names.
        Parameters:
        app - Micro-Manager application instance
        core - Micro-Manager CMMCore
        groupName - Name of the configuration group
        groupChannelNames - Array of the channel names
        affectedMMProps - MMproperties affected by the group

      • setStringValue

        public void setStringValue(java.lang.String stringval,
                  UIProperty source)
        Description copied from class: MMProperty
        Sets the value of the device property and updates all parent UIProperties. This method is called by a parent UIProperty, and the source is excluded from the notification (using MMProperty.notifyListeners(UIProperty, String)). The method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Overrides:
        setStringValue in class MMProperty<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        stringval - New value.
        source - UIProperty at the origin of the update.

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(java.lang.String val)
        Description copied from class: MMProperty
        Tests if val in the allowed range of the MMProperty, that is to say is smaller than the upper limit and larger than the lower limit. If minimum and maximum have been set to values different than the upper and lower limit, then val is in range if it is contained between the minimum and the maximum. If the property doesn't have limits, this method should return true.
        Specified by:
        isInRange in class MMProperty<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        val - Value to be checked
        Returns:
        True if in range, false otherwise

      • isAllowed

        public boolean isAllowed(java.lang.String val)
        Description copied from class: MMProperty
        Tests if val is allowed. If the property has neither limits nor allowed values, then the method should return true. If the property has limits, then this method should be equivalent to isInRange().
        Specified by:
        isAllowed in class MMProperty<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        val - Value to be checked
        Returns:
        True if allowed, false otherwise.
